-Bi Bim Bap ($10.95): Honestly this wasn't that great. Didn't have a lot of meat and veggies, mostly rice. It's a dish that's not bad, but not great either if that makes sense.
 
I would come again to try out the other dishes (: the only other complaint that I have is that they only had 1 server when I went, and the restaurant was fully packed. The waiter was really nice, but since it was so busy, he often forgot some of our orders.
author: Jackie T.

description: I wasn't too amazed by this place. We ordered some pork belly and it was not made very well. The meat was pretty tough. Not my first choice of place to go on the block and I definitely would not go out of my way to visit here but it is an OK option for late night eating if you happen to be nearby.
author: Alice H.

description:
I do not recommend this place for food. We ordered Seafood Pancake, kimchi fried rice, Dol Sot Bibimbap, fried chicken, and got free gyoza from checking in. The only dish that had any flavor at all was the seafood pancake. The rest was bland and tasteless. Kimchi fried rice had no seasoning, dol sot bibimbap barely had meat, and fried chicken meat was tasteless. Seafood pancake was good but I wonder why they would leave shrimp tail shells in the pancake? They were definitely cheap on their ingredients....

Service was pretty bad. They forgot to give us tea and utensils. They bring bibimbap without spoons to mix with. The waitress didn't know how to serve dishes properly...her way of making room for food was to force the plate on the table even though there were other plates there already.  One time she almost pushed the ban chan off the table! At the end she tried to give us someone else's leftovers. It was so bad that it was comical. 

I didn't try to soju. It actually looks delicious. Maybe this is more of a drinking place than dinner place?
author: Tina S.

description:
The Crew is serving up Korean & Japanese Fusion food in the quiet Noriega corridor. I think it's the new kid on the block because the old "Pine Restaurant" signage is still outside. My boyfriend and I were just driving by in search of Korean food and we didn't even know this was The Crew. But what luck we had finding this place! 

The inside is bright and clean. It's a straight aisle to the counter, to the left are 3 semi-private booths/ tables with large bamboo "curtains" hanging half-way down and on the right are open tables able to seat large parties. 

They seem to be just starting up, no take out menus yet but a well thought-out menu full of Korean and Japanese noms was set for us to peruse. The waiter was really nice and even gave us green tea and edamame even though we had to order to-go!!! Extra star for you mister. I'm such a sucker for free stuff and good service. 

Got a "bento" of spicy pork and japchae for $9.95. Came with a little box of rice- slightly undercooked, bit hard. and a huge take out box with 1/4 spicy pork, 1/4 japchae, 1/4 pickled radish & beancurd and, of course, 1/4 kimchi. 

I would have liked a little bit more noodles and less rice BUT the food was pretty good quality and delicious, so I'm still satisfied. 

I can not wait to come back and dine-in. Also gotta try the drink specials on their white board: orange mango tango soju....whhhhatttt?! Yes please!
author: Eva H.

description: i've got one word for this place....AMAZEBALLS!!!!! wow....just wow!!!! it's like there's a party in my mouth and everyone is invited
author: Poop M.

description: I checked in because we were going to eat here but left because no one came to serve us.  They dropped the menu and that was the last we saw of the waitress. Unfortunately, not entirely the waitress' fault since she seemed to be the only one working and the restaurant was full.  I may....may give this place a chance again but for now, it's only one star.  However, if this place is crowded just go across the street to the won ton house.  That is a great place.
author: Michael O.

description:
I first visited here because it was a new Korean restaurant near my place.  Now I like to come here cause the Japchae is so good.  Very delicious yam noodles.  BBQ chicken was nice and tender.  Tofu soup was a bit on the small side compared to other places, but mild spice was the perfect spice level for me.
Skip the Sausage Vegetable Roast, it's a waste of money.  It's basically sweet and sour sauce drenching sausages and a lot of onions and bell peppers.
I'll be coming here a lot.
author: Karen L.

description:
The food was really really good!! Only knock is that they take a while to bring out the food. But if you want great quality, it's worth the wait!! 

Oh and the ramen and chicken wings were delicious!
author: Gregory L.

description:
The food and prices were decent. What stood out to me was the awesome service! I came here for lunch with my friends on a Tuesday around 1:00pm. I arrived a little earlier than they did and the waiter had me seated at a table and served me tea. 

I wish I could've gotten his name! Anyway, he was very nice and patient with us. I hadn't realized they were closing for lunch! You know, some places usually try and rush you out.. He always made sure that we had tea and were taken care of. He also gave us a free bottle of their Lychee Mango Yogurt Soju (minus the soju) which was really good! 

I just wanted to say, you're awesome! Keep up the great service (:
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Five of us came here on a weeknight for dinner.  The restaurant was about 2/3 full when we arrived but we had reservations and were seated promptly. Food was good and service was friendly - only complaint was they were slow to clear off empty plates. Prices are reasonable with most main dishes in the $9-15 range. For the five of us, our bill came to $94 not including tip

Plates of food are all large enough to share with 2-3 people. 

We had:

Soju - comes in a 12 oz bottle with some shot sized glasses. 

Gyoza - free with Yelp check in. They were small but pretty tasty

Fried chicken wings -  moist and crispy

BBQ combo - It comes with beef, pork belly, and intestines (!). We were not feeling adventurous enough to try the intestines so they let us substitute chicken. Meats were all tender and very flavorful

Sausage vegetable roast - This was my least favorite dish. Consisted mostly of onions with some tiny sausages that tasted like hot dogs all smothered in sauce.


Will definitely have to come back and try their ramen!
author: Bumble B.

description:
Not impressed.
First of all, we got seated at the yakiniku table, which allows you to cook your own food.  It literally is a wine barrel under a table top.  I'm 5 feet tall, and I had to straddle the barrel in order to sit at the table. 
Service - very slow.  It took a good 20 minutes to get our first dish.  Then, we ordered the seafood pancake and got the kimchee pancake instead.  So it took another 30 minute to get the right order to us, and by then we were already done with eating.  You'd think that because the error is theirs, they would put the correction to the top of the queue, but no, that did not happen.
Food - Seafood pancake (when we finally got it) was greasey and lacks seafood.
Chop chae - It's vegetarian, and the menu does not say that.  I've never been to a Korean restaurant that serves chop chae with no meat.  And it was quite juicy, you can literally slurp the damn noodles.  Not how it's supposed to be cooked.
BBQ chicken - It was BBQ's alright, seasoned with salt and pepper only.  There was no Korean seasoning or sauce whatsoever.  We asked for mild thinking we'd get mild sauces, but the meat was not marinaded at all like Korean meats should have been.
Rice - They are real skimpy on the rice, whats up with that?  We were party of two and ordered three dishes.  You'd think that they would serve us two bowls of rice.  No, only one bowl allowed.  I'll pass the next time.
author: R W.

description: I like all the food here. The side dishes are pretty standard, nothing special. The food is tasty, but not cheap. Service is good and service folks are nice. I will be back bc there aren't many Korean food options around and this one is decent.
author: Kudos K.

description: When I crave Tofu Soup or some seafood pancake, this place is the spot to go! They have good food and descent portions for the price. The only drawback is that it does get crowded during dinner time and I think it is a family owned place so the kitchen gets really slow when they are at full seating capacity.
author: Franz C.

description:
Came in here for a lunch special with a friend few days ago ... It is around $10 per person, which is a good price but the quality of food this time is not as good as the dinner and also service is bad. 

I order a dumpling ramen , but it is actually two dumpling plus a obviously is a instant noodle. Totally not worth the money ! And the side dish did not come , I asked the waitress two times then she gave it to us. 

I will not come back for the lunch but will consider coming back for dinner
author: Priscilla F.

description: The food here is excellent! By far one of the best Korean restaurants I've been to. Interior is compact and cozy and the waiters are accommodating and nice. My friend and I came during the Warrior's 6th game playoffs and the place was pretty packed and the atmosphere was energetic and upbeat. Now onto the food! We ordered a spicy chicken and a kimchi jiege and it came with 5 different banchan (side dishes). Everything was flavorful and super yummy! If I didn't live so far away, I would come here more often!
author: Annabel H.

description:
Inconsistent even though it was my first time dining at The Crew last week.

My brother decided to take me to try since he had a good experience with his friends last time he went and of course i love trying new places near my house.

Service was good  -- love the little appetizers and the waitress even refilled without us asking for more.

ordered:
1. Takoyaki - really good. made me miss Hawaii. not mushy and there was plenty of octupus
2. Seafood pancake -- As my brother stated totally DIFFERENT than last time he tried it. The dough came out really flaky and what seafood?!! there was only a few pieces of shrimp and most of it was chives. it also lacked in flavor? i had to request the sweet and spicy red sauce people usually used for bigogi. The sauce made it better. 
3. chicken fried wings - didnt expect to be just fried thought it would be dripped in sauce? it was okay. 

overall, my dining experience was average. would like to come back to try their soju cocktails when they are available (maybe the person who took the pics of the cocktails should take the down picture because they are not available at the restaurant yet.) causes confusion. 

hope The Crew does well because the restaurant has potential and plus it got kinda busy around 7pm. But the food needs to be CONSISTENT and thats how you keep your customers coming back :)
author: Carol Y.

description: I'm just gonna give this place a 2/5 stars because it was 8:44pm when I started to write this last night and we've been waiting for our food since the Warriors game started which was at 7:30pm. It's a complete turn off when you're not acknowledged for like 15 minutes, then you finally sit down and then you wait another 10 minutes for the server to give you your menu and then wait another 20 minutes to come take your order. No utensils for at least 10 minutes and no water until 10 more minutes of us just asking the server for water. Some of our food came in an hour and a half later. The server messed up on two of our tofu soup orders. So guess how many more minutes my friends had to wait? You guessed it! 20 more minutes. We were there for the whole entire Warriors game. The food was very good. The sweet and spicy chicken was as described but it was not worth an almost 2 hour wait for our food. They didn't even compensate us for the 2 soups that they messed up on in which they had to wait closest to 2 hours. It was already the end of the 3rd/beginning of the 4th quarter when they got their tofu soup. This post could have been 4 stars if the service was better but my experience became a 2. Food is no longer good to me if I have to wait an hour and a half for it. We could have gone to 2 other soju spots and eat there and come back to still no food at this spot. Don't think I'll be coming back here for a long time just because of this bad experience.
author: Keng G.

description:
It's the most average Korean food I've ever had. You can get this anywhere in the Bay Area. 

We had the bibimbop and the gyoza. Everything was ok. We ate on the early side and the place was empty. Slowly it filled up with young people. 

The place felt a little sad to me. Like the business was on it's last legs. A huge television blasted Asian pop music videos. 

Nice people - seemed to be a family business. We wouldn't have eaten here if we weren't starving and needed a kid-friendly, cheap option.
author: Sam S.

description: Stopped by cause I was craving Kimchi fried rice. To my surprise pretty big portion and couldn't finish it. I also ordered the fried chicken which was decent but I love fried chicken period. Staff was friendly and checked up on me. My belly left happy. That is all.
author: Amanda N.

description:
I really like this place. came here when it first opened about 2 years ago and came back again yesterday. the food has progressively gotten better. the whole chicken, Kalbi, Seafood pancake. seafood tofu soup- all generous in portion and delicious in taste. 
The waitress was very attentive - she made sure our tea was filled and made sure the ban chan never ran out regardless of the busy rush hour. 
The atmosphere of the restaurant was very ambient and comfortable as I felt very relaxed the whole time I was there. 
I cannot wait to come back again!
author: Tennyson Zhu ..

description:
Came because of the hype. Good food calls for good customers. What I had wasnt good food.

I ordered the bbq combo of beef shortrib, pork belly, and small intestines. A friend checked in and got the Gyoza and the spicy tofu soup with seafood.

The shortribs were underseasoned and just bland. The pork belly? Nicely charred, but underseasoned and dry. The intestines were gritty. 

Which meant they were NOT clean.

The seafood soup and the gyoza we got for free was possibly the best thing we had all night.

Which does not bode well as we werent happy with the hot sizzling mess I paid for.

Two stars for the nice and pretty waitresses. none for the food.
author: Ivan J.

description: Came here on a wednesday night with the wifey to give her a break from cooking. She tried the Soft Tofu soup and i had the Dolsat Bibimbap and both were super delicious. We also ordered fried chicken and suprsingly it was pretty darn good with the spicy sweet sauce. The portion was a little smaller than what i had expected but for $13 it was a good dish to share. I will definitely come back again soon and try there BBQ short ribs.
author: Phil H.

description: First time eating Korean food. I had the Dolsot Bibimbap. Came in on a Sunday night and my food came out nice and hot. One of the best meals I've had in a while. The staff was extremely helpful in helping me pick an entree. Everyone was so friendly. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone that's in the area. I was only in town for a couple days but this was by far my favorite meal.
author: Bill T.

description: Decent food but prices have hiked up dramatically since the last time I've been here. Banchan is not unlimited like other Korean places. I totally forgot to check in for free gyoza.
author: W A.

description: Great Korean food! Small little place on Noriega. They have great kimchee! I love their soft tofu soup and fish cake soup!
author: Jessie S.

description:
Great service! Huge portions! 

I came here to celebrate my friends birthday and I ordered the kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake and the Korean fried chicken. 

Kimchi fried rice was good, better than Manna tbh. Seafood pancake was thick and had a whole bunch of random seafood in there. (Bomb and so filling). The Korean fried chicken was probably the most disappointing out of all three dishes I got. They forgot about it, but the manager came out and apologized himself, so it's all good. I couldn't even finish any of the other foods.


Oh and I almost forgot! I checked in and got free gyoza's! So good!
author: Tracy V.

description:
I wish I paid more attention to their yelp page to see that free gyoza came with a check-in to the restaurant; I didn't and am now regretting it :(
But that's ok! The food we ordered made up for it. 

My bf and I came here on a whim late one Friday night, pretty much starving. I yelped somewhere to eat that was open late (this was around 2345-0000) and since we were in the area, this place popped up. We decided to give it a try and are pretty glad we did. Bc it was late, we were able the find parking right in front and were seated upon arrival.

We ordered the bi bim bap (on hot stone plate?), kimchi fried rice, deep fried garlic wings, and 2 pitchers of soju, one strawberry and the other lychee. All were bombbb. Maybe we were just hungry, idk, but it really hit the spot. Portions were decent; what we ordered was more than enough for 2. We actually had to take most of the kimchi fried rice home (yay leftovers). And the soju...soo good, you can actually taste the alcohol! (We've compared The Crew to CoCoBang on Taylor. Verdict: The Crew was a clear winner, at least from our experience). The 6 banchans here we also really enjoyed. 

Overall, very tasty food, refreshing soju, great experience. Service was also great. Our waitress was quick and attentive, which we appreciated. We will be back!
author: Melis A.

description:
Sorry I'm from Korea/LA and although it's probably okay for SF, I have to judge by my own taste.
It was subpar.
author: Toro O.

description: Awesome place to eat korean food. Love their seafood pancake and chicken sweet and spicy. The staff is sweet and super attentive with their customers. Best place to come for soju.
author: Brenda M.

description: I love the tofu soup and my husband gets the bbq something... Crispy. Open late when we leave the cover field, quick to pick up.
author: Lillian S.

description: A hidden gem. Opens late. there is a gentleman waiter there, he was super nice. it was really busy, and he bust his butt to give every table service. he kept apologizing for the wait for the seating and for the food. he gave us free yogurt drinks for the wait! that blew my mind! give this guy a raise! they can be understaffed at times. the food is great here and the side dishes are good too.
author: Jules L.

description: Came into the place at about 9:30 PM, and there was a decent murmur of people. Waitstaff very friendly. Got the grilled spicy pork, which was thickly basted and very tasty. Could have been spicier for me, but I'm sure the heat level would have been just enough for lots of people. The cold condiments and stuff were plentiful, about 7 little dishes of accoutrement. Got a LARGE bottle (they call it a pitcher) of Cass beer, which was really nice and went well with the barbecue.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
Recommend chicken, soft tofu soup, kimchi fried rice, gyoza.

Jap chae is OK. It's warm and not as flavorful as I expect
author: Derek M.

description: Great service! Server was so nice, explaining all the dishes and adjusting our spice levels to our liking.  Come around 10 ish and it's quite . Meats were really good! 5 stars! Will come again!
author: Sian C.

description:
3.5 but rounding up to a 4. 

Jap chae was OK, though slightly too far on the sweet side and a bit greasy. The bf's dolsot bibimbap looked very good though, and had a nice assortment of veggies with the meat (I think it was bulgogi). 

I was not impressed with the banchan as the broccoli was baby food-soft and therefore overcooked. The spicy fish cake was also very, very soft and did not have any chew to it. I liked that they included the spicy fish cake as you tend to not really get that as banchan, but it could have been better.

I am rounding up from 3.5 to 4 because of service. Service was almost a bit overkill as the servers were constantly walking back and forth and checking on their tables, but I appreciated the effort as it really sucks at restaurants when service ignores you.
author: Steph S.

description:
The service was pretty awesome. Our waiter Ryan, gave us a free order of gyoza with the yelp sponsorship. The seating is quite fast, however the tables were quite old. 
The prices were reasonable enough, though relatively expensive considering the other korean restaurants around the city. 
The food was great. I ordered a pork babimpap. The pork was succulent and delicious. 
Overall, above average.
author: Irving C.

description:
The Crew opened up in a place that also used to be a Korean restaurant. They have done some nice improvements to the place such as putting two TVs in. One of which plays kpop music and music. The other one was on a sports channel.

== Food ==

Tofu soup tastes good! Pretty good portion of soup with a nice broth and soft tofu.

Korean fried chicken wings are really crispy and the sauce they used tastes a bit tangy and sweet. Definitely recommended if you like crispy fried chicken.

Kalbi Ribs is great. Nicely marinated and the meat was soft. It comes with rice.

There's some typical Korean side dishes that come with your order.

== Service ==

The food takes some time to come out but it comes out hot and nice. Be ready to sit down and talk or drink for a bit before getting your food.

== Overall ==

Good stuff! This place is a lot better than the old restaurant that used to be here. The food is a little pricey but the quality is good.
author: Steven B.

description:
The Crew is currently sponsoring a Yelp Check In offer for a free order of gyoza.  However, they refused to honor the offer for us.  The waitress claimed we needed to tell them about the offer before we placed our order (we presented the offer before we requested our check).  Keep in mind there was no mention of this 'requirement' in the fine print.  The waitress then claimed that it was impossible for her to remove the order from our check (I call BS) and since it was 1am, there was no manager to speak to (more BS).

I suspect she just didn't know how to properly run the offer on our check, and/or was too lazy to rerun the transaction.
author: Christopher M.

description: The Crew is 2 blocks away from my house, I go there once a week. Highly recommend the tofu soup and the fried rice cake.
author: Joss L.

description:
I really liked this place, The server was really friendly and helpful as well. They have little buzzers that you can ring when you want service and I think ours didn't really work but we didn't have a problem because he was checking on us anyway. 
           The food is fantastic too, We had takoyaki, bonded pork jowl and kimchi cheese pancake. Everything we had was great and I would recommend to anyone. I was especially impressed with the pork jowl, it was cooked just right, with just the right amount of chew and the sesame oil and salt/pepper dip just complimented it so well that alone was a fantastic dining experience. 
        The kimchi pancake was pretty great, we got the one with cheese which was good but I almost think I should have tried it without cheese just to get more of the kimchi flavor coming through. We asked for the habanero sauce, I'm not sure if they make it or where they get it but it was phenomenal. It's not as hot as you would think, it's a little sweet and full of flavor. It gave just the right kick and I would recommend you request it for a number of their dishes. 
        I don't go to the sunset a whole lot but I'm definitely going back here again.
author: Mark D.

description: I always come to this restaurant because "Korean" chiefs cook and their foods' portion is always big compared to other Korean restaurants'. I recommend this place to my friends and they get satisfaction too:)
author: Kimberly K.

description:
We were excited to have a new Korean option in this part of the Sunset. Unfortunately we left underwhelmed after our first visit, as there was nothing really noteworthy about the place.

We opted to order their beef soft tofu lunch special, chicken wings, and the gyoza (courtesy of the Yelp check-in, of course).

The soft tofu was bland and arguably tasted a watered down. The chicken wings were just average, or a bit below it, and lacked any true flavor. The gyoza was probably the best of the three and even then they were just so-so.

Maybe they were having an off day, but we didn't see any reason to come back and felt let down by their 4 star average. The Yelp offer is pretty nice, the service was good, and the parking was easy enough, however we'll stick to Manna as our go-to for now.
author: Mike K.

description: Came by on Friday night. The food is amazing and the staff is friendly. The servings are great and definitely filled me up. The waitress also came by every now and then to see if we needed anything. Wait time wasn't too bad. About 10 minutes with almost every table being used. Not bad. Only downside is The tables are a little to short for me since I'm almost 6 foot. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Jose S.

description: Great food and great service. I love the way they all hustle. Makes it look like they're working hard for their clients. Oh, ya... And the food is delicious! I got Kalbi Tang, the Mrs. Got the Soon dubu chigae, boys got the fried chicken and kalbi, and my baby girl got the Bibimbop! Ummm ummmm...
author: Adrian D.

description: Aaah! This place was so yummy! First time ever coming here tonight and was definitely worth my money, although a little bit on the pricier side. I got a spicy tofu soup with beef (regular spicy) and was not bad at all, considering that I can handle spicy at an okay amount. I recommend coming here if you have up to a medium-sized party and are craving some Korean food! The service was very good and would always check up on the table! Although my party was pretty big and seemed to cause a little bit of trouble, the staff were still super nice and made conversation. Definitely recommend coming to The Crew. :-)
author: Michelle C.

description:
We came here because it was open late.  Got a second helping of the delicious BBQ ribs; if I come here again I might not bother trying anything else.  Well, maybe I'll try the fried wings with mango-habanero sauce if I can squelch my inner Surgeon General.  Free gyoza were nothing special, but hey, free. Pitcher of water left on the table was much appreciated.

Bill came to $54 for two of us but we left absolutely stuffed.
author: Aliza P.

description:
I feel obligated to write a review for this particular restaurant for I am a native Korean. For that reason, I can live on just eating KFC ( slightly exaggerated)
Koreans are generally crazy about KFC, it's just.. that good.

And this place finally delivers it right. Yes, namugaji does it very well too, but where as they give you 2,3 pieces of chicken for $13.. this place gives the whole damn chicken for $17 and it tastes just as good!!!

I hope more people try this place and get the words out.. (maybe not??) so this place will stay in business for a long time.

I loved the owner guy came up to us telling us how he prepares the chicken every morning:) I could taste the love.

Just try their special KFC..!!
author: Sung C.

description:
I came here after class with my girlfriend for lunch. Since we came here right at opening(11:30) there was already people lining up outside. Talk about being popular. Haha

The server sat us right away and handed us the menu. I ordered the beef bolgogi and my girlfriend ordered the kimchi ramen. We also did a check in gonza. 
 
The food didn't take long to come. I was kind of puzzled when they lady ask me how many bowl of rice did I want with the bolgogi. I confusedly said one. She then reassure me that the rice was free. Phew. Haha. 
Overall  the place served real good food and that the server was always checking up on us making sure we were okay. 

I would recommend people coming here to try it out!
author: Andy S.

description:
tried The Crew at lunch. lunch specials-korean food and some fusion burgers. the dinner menu also available.

eats: bi bim Bap(8.95)
-6 banchan and the bi bim bap with all fresh veggies, ingredients
everything tasted fresh though bland, certainly no msg tasted.
-would order something else next
-Bi a lot better than the one next door
-tummy was full, happy, so
3.5 stars

foodnotes:
-very friendly service, checkins
-not sure what their forte is.
author: Victor G.

description:
Their deep-fried chicken wings.. are one of the best KFC (KOREAN. fried. chicken, not Kentucky) in SF if you ask me. Came here with some friends and ordered some appetizers before getting to the main course. Takoyaki and gyoza were "okay". A bit bland and taste was feeling like something was missing. Can't point out what though. The calamari on the other hand was pretty delicious. 

Next up was the Seafood Pancake and Budae Jjigae hotpot. It was good too. Fair amount to share with a people of five. The waitress that served us was patient and friendly as well. Funny though, how one of my friends and I were going to ask for water and before we could - we already saw her walking to our table with a few cups and a bottle of water. We didn't even need to ask! We got our fried chicken and it was about 8 pieces. We thought one plate would be good enough to share, but nope. For a bunch of gymheads around their late 20's and early 30's .. what were we thinking?? All of us tried a piece and then decided to each order a plate to ourselves. Seasoning was on-point! Meat was tender, juicy and crisp. 

We came into consensus and agreed that the chicken here is the best thing on the menu. Proportions were a bit small each time we came and quite pricey (had an "oh.." look on our faces when the bill came out) but it's THAT great. Definitely recommend it to people or first-timers here.. it's a standard must to get their chicken wings.
author: David C.

description: If you've ever been to Tonight on Taraval this place is just like that, except maybe not as nice. The food is pretty average for a Soju place, the kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake and fried chicken are all pretty good but not really special. They're not very generous with their side dishes (sometimes you have to ask) Soju drinks are also good price is pretty standard when compared to the other soju places in the area. They play K-pop hits and it's a good place for groups especially since its not as busy as some of the more popular soju spots. Overall pretty good place but nothing too special, a good place if you don't wanna have to wait.
author: Antonio W.

description:
Tried this place with a friend for some fried food galore. We were able to get a table pretty quick on a Friday night. It isn't one of the better Korean restaurants that I have tried but they have some good comfort food to boot. 

Free gyoza  for us:) even if we were pretty full from all the food that we ordered. 
We tried their famous fried chicken which was alright, the breading was good but I wish it had more flavoring, might have wanted to try the sauced up chicken next time. 
Seafood pancake was okay, nothing too special. 
My friend and I opted to try the cheese stuffed katsu... pretty greasy but we couldn't really hate it as it was oozing with cheesy goodness. 

Overall, an okay place, nothing too special. The service was a little abrupt and it seemed like we were being rushed a little bit.
author: Tracy Joy K.

description: My girlfriend and I come here frequently for dinner, and it's quickly become one of our go-to spots. The space is very cozy, but because we've only come on weeknights, we've never had to wait. The food is delicious. My favorites are the fried chicken, the dukbokki, and the kimchi pancake. The service staff is also very friendly and attentive. Overall, a fantastic neighborhood Korean place that's worth going to over and over again.
author: Lawrence W.

description:
Whenever I come here with my friends we usually get the Kimchi Fried Rice, Sweet & Spicy half of a chicken-chicken wings, gyoza, and yogurt soju. 

Food is good, their wings are the best and their speciality. I've had better kimchi fried rice. Their soju cocktail is sweet but good. They are open until 2am which is awesome especially since right next door is a bar. 

My friends and I also come here when it's really late or just for the wings. It's good, not great.
author: Lisa Y.

description:
The traditional Korean food as in Bulgolgi, chijimi, and kimchi were rather good.  
The KFC was not my cup of tea at all.  It's like taking the deep fried part of sweet and sour pork and serving that up alone.
author: Peter O.

description:
came here for late dinner after 9pm.  we wanted chicken wings but they ran out! boooo
got gyoza, squid, and soy bean paste stew.  flavors were all ok.  gyoza tasted perfumey and weird.  nice crispy exterior though.  squid had much more vegetables and onions than squid.  bean paste stew lacked flavor and had a lot of onions.

pan chan was good.  liked the kimchi and fish cake.
author: Linda T.

description: The wings weren't all that they were hyped up to be. I wish they were a lot crispier and less saucy. I think it was a little too sweet. Also, we were seated at a table and then a larger group comes in so they ask us to change tables.  The service was okay, they never really checked up on us. I wouldn't come back here again
author: Bianca D.

description: Pretty good! Came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and did not have to wait or a table. We ordered a bibimbap, got the free gyoza, and the regular fried chicken. Way too much food for 2. The order of fried chicken was much bigger than the pictures posted by others. The bibimbap was a decent size and the potstickers was deep fried to a good crunch without over frying. The waiter was super helpful and nice and was happy to refill my banchan. The chicken could've used a little more flavor (we got the regular fried chicken) may try the garlic one next time. Overall solid meal :)
author: Janice A.

description:
Very cheap lunch special. Great selection and portion.
The garlic chicken wings are amazing! The sweet and spicy ones, meh, not quite good. We tried both kinds so you all wont have to. So if you're gonna order the sweet and spicy wings and doesnt like them, I told you so.
Alright, lets move on to the main. The cook on the kalbi is surprisingly good. The meat is tender and well marinated. I like how they cut up the bones into thinner slices instead of serving a whole chunk of bones like other restaurants. Main reason is the chewy part around the bone is my favorite part of kalbi.
I wasnt impressed with the bulgogi and the bi bim bap, which wasnt served in a stone pot (maybe because i ordered during lunch special). 
But overall we enjoyed our meal
author: Alan T.

description:
Fried Chicken Wings. That is it. 

I have no idea what spices they use- but they are just amazing. I love the people who run this business, especially June - he is always so nice and always has a smile on his face. Great customer service! 

That's what I love - great customer service! But seriously, get the fried chicken wings. They are deeeelish
author: Aloha D.

description: The best Korean resteraunt in SF! good service, refilled side-dishes, and most of all that KAL-BI-TANG made my day!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I'm really not the type of person to give bad reviews, but since I rely on Yelp a lot for my dining experiences, I'd rather let people know and be helpful. 

This place is only 4 blocks away from my house and I was very excited to hear about their opening - a new spot in my area is always a good thing! My mom and I walked down the street there last night hoping to have a great Korean food experience. Unfortunately, we were highly disappointed. I ordered the soft tofu soup with vegetables and it was extremely bland. Also, there were pretty much no vegetables in there. My mom ordered the short rib soup and was extremely confused - there were only bones in the soup, but no meat. She asked the waiter (who was actually very nice and attentive) where the meat was. He basically tried to tell her that meat is not supposed to go on short ribs. Funny, because every time she ordered short ribs or cooks with short ribs, there's always meat there. Her soup was $16.95 and it probably cost The Crew $0.50 to make... 

Sadly, we will not be coming back and unless you want to pay a good amount of money for watered down, meatless soups - I wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Anastasia N.

description:
The food here is meh in my opinion. Everything is too greasy & not very good. We ordered takoyaki which wasn't very tasty at all. The octopus was too chewy & the dough was average. I've had good quality takoyaki and this one doesn't live up to anything I would consider good. 
We also got the seafood pancake. The flavor was good, but the grease and fry was way too much. After eating it, I felt like I was going to be sick because I could feel all the oils affecting my body.
author: Janey H.

description: If you want to try authentic korean food, you should go!! Foods are so good and not that too spicy and too sweet. I usually enjoy Kalbi and soft tofu.
author: Soo-young J.

description:
3.5 stars. Free gyoza when you check in, but it was only ok. Love the banchan. Had my favorite fishcakes. The fried chicken wings were like KFC. The Kimchi fried rice wasn't bad, but the Kalbi was really good. I was surprised. 

I miss the old Korean restaurant here. My friend and I were the only customers. Service is friendly. I don't think I'll be back.
author: Karen H.

description: I'd give this place 4.5 stars if I could... Ate here for the first time today and I'll definitely be going back. We walked in right as it opened and the waitress greeted us very enthusiastically and provided EXCELLENT service throughout. We had the BBQ short ribs,  beef bulgolgi,  chicken wings with sweet/spicy sauce,  and gyoza (free with check in!) as well as unlimited side dishes. All of the food was fresh and delicious,  with the chicken wings being the standout dish of the meal. I'd definitely recommend this place to a friend.
author: Zachary M.

description: Came here after another place nearby didn't work out.  What a find this was.  We love Korean food and never heard of this place before.  This was the best Korean food we have had.  I loved the spicy chicken.  My wife had fish cake soup and said it was the best she has had.  The kids had soft tofu soup that they loved.  The waitress was very attentive and helpful, with plenty of refills on the side dishes and beverages without asking. Will definitely be returning regularly.
author: Steven B.

description:
We ordered the korean fried whole chicken, galbi, kimchi fried rice, and gyoza.  The service was pretty slow, took a while to take our order. Then we got the galbi first, chicken second, kimchi fried rice, then side dishes, then our beer, then the gyoza.  Each dish had quite a few minutes in between.

The food itself was quite good, the kimchi fried rice was a huge serving, and everything tasted really nice and for a great price. Outside of the service this is a great place. 

Regardless of the service, I'll still be coming back for the food and value!
author: Jon B.

description:
Came here one night around 10pm. I definitely like that this place is open late. We walked in and the place had a good amount of people in it. There were already three tables occupied. We wanted to try the whole fried chicken, but they were unfortunately out. Also, our waiter disappeared in the middle of taking our order to deliver a dish to another table. It was a bit abrupt, but he was the only one working. 

What we ordered:

Croquettes - Good standard tasting croquettes. Nothing out of the ordinary. 

Japchae - I thought this was pretty good. Nice flavor and nicely presented. 

Seafood Pancake - This was probably my favorite dish. It was nice and fluffy and flavorful. The slices were cut to a perfect size and is good to feed 4-6 people.

Deep Fried Chicken Wings - Pretty good. I feel like chicken wings are a staple at a lot of late night korean spots. It was good. I kind of wish we got the sauce, but it was $2 extra. 

Mozzarella stuffed Tonkatsu - Definitely did not taste like mozzarella. It wasn't bad though. When it came out, it was nice and hot. 

FREE Gyoza - We got these with a Yelp check in. Good tasty fried gyoza. I'd say order these if you like gyoza. 

Overall the food is decent. Would I come back here? Probably. Not my first choice for Korean food though. Parking is okay. I came late night, so there was no issue. I can see some issue during the daytime. Hopefully I come back and try some other dishes.
author: Steph W.

description: I absolutely love this place!  Definitely try the rice cakes & kimchi fried rice, both are delicious.  I've been a regular for sometime now and definitely recommend this spot.
author: Michael David B.

description: Came here for lunch with my family in the middle of running errands on my day off. Staff was friendly and accommodating of my threenager as she wasn't on her best behavior that day and they really didn't seem to mind. Lunch specials were affordable and food was tasty.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Good vibes. Good music. Good drinks. Good service. Good food.

This place is awesome, although finding parking is tough (it's the city) I really like this place. The server there is super nice, and vey pretty! The only downside to this place is that it's small, but other than that it's a hidden gem. I really like it, and their menu is very diverse. Going to go back as soon as I can, to experience the late night drinking environment. 

I was only there for dinner.
author: John C.

description:
Was here with 3 other friends on Labor Day. When we got there, we had to put our name down. A group of 7 before us were already waiting. I walked in to use the restroom and saw 3 tables open ... one of the servers told us to wait ten minutes. Okay...but why? Good thing it wasn't that cold outside, we would've freeze our butts off. 

Finally got a table but no menus were given. So all four of us sat there looking at other people's food. After we got our menus, looked through it and decided on what we wanted. We were eyeing the waitress but she didn't look our way. My bf even raised his hand and she passed but ignored him. The place is small but it was not even that busy. An "I'll be right with you" would've been great. At least I know you're not ignoring us! She finally came over to take our orders and that was about 10 mins later. -_-" While taking our order, no smiles or greetings were given. What's up with that? I'm a paying customer and if you want good tips, you have to earn it! 
Anyway, we ordered a whole bunch of food. We had kalbi, jap chae, seafood pancake, deep fried whole chicken, tako yaki, beef bugolgi, and dol sot bi bim bop.  I can tell you that I didn't enjoy most of them. Every dish was overpowered by msg or something. It was so salty. The fried chicken was so dry, I asked the male server for lemon wedge to moisten it up. Didn't work. Jap chae had too much flavor but not in a good way. This was actually the saltiest dish compared to the others. Kalbi was on the tough side and I didn't like how it was marinated. The best part of the meal was the dol sot bi bim bop. Especially after I asked them to give me a raw egg that I cracked it in myself. 

Now about the service. The best part of this place was the service we received by the male server. He came by and checked on us and cleared plates. The female server...after she took our order, she never came back to check on us. I didn't really want to give her any tips. But this place seemed family owned, I'm pretty share the workers there share their tips. In the end, we did not tip bad and actually tipped 18% because the male server did his best to serve us, hence the extra star. I know why Yelp doesn't allow giving no stars because without that one star, you're not really rating the place. You're just writing a bad review but not rating the restaurant. So this restaurant gets two stars from me. I've bookmarked this place for a while now and finally tried it. Yup, it's safe to remove this place because my friends and I all agreed that we're not coming back.
author: B L.

description:
This place is decent. We ordered the bulgogi, the spicy pork, and the jap-chae, and everything tasted wonderful! the bad thing about the food was the that bulgogi, something that every korean restaurant should master (since its a staple), was very tough. a bit chewy, nothing like beef jerky but still chewy and kind of dry. In addition, the jap-chae noodles were a bit under-done. However, I really liked the spicy pork. Super flavorful and not over cooked. Another thing was that my friend and I came here particularly to try the soju, but the "bartender" was out, so the whole soju menu (half of the drink menu) was basically off the list. Lastly, it was slightly over priced, not too bad, but not worth it for this experience. I would give this restaurant another try, but order something else. 

On a different note, the waitress was very sweet and polite, but a bit slow at times.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Came in late (11:30pm) on a Thursday night. Toyose was an hour wait..sooo, we went here! No wait here! haha. Not bad--we checked in on yelp for that free gyoza appetizer. 6 pieces. Perfect for the group of the night! In addition to that, we ordered a small lemon soju cocktail, bulgogi bbq plate, kimchi fried rice, and seafood pancake. They also had a variety of banchan for us to enjoy. Dude kept that broccoli and tofu coming. haha. Thanks!

Gyoza appetizer: mm, pan fried goodness. yums especially since they were free. :P
Bulgogi BBQ plate: decent portion--lots of onions though. came with a bowl of white rice, which is nice!
Kimchi fried rice: good flavor, good portion, pretty flavorful.
Seafood pancake: wish it wasn't as soggy, but pretty much your standard seafood pancake. 
Lemon soju: wooow strong. definitely got our money's worth. haha. :D

Overall, I'd come back, especially when Toyose's wait is ridiculous.
We were all fairly full and didn't make too much of a dent in our wallets!
author: Mariel A.

description: dont come here! i checked my credit card because i know restaurants overcharge your card sometimes and this restaurant happens to have done it to my card. charged it an extra dollar. i know that's not a lot of money but it's not ok to steal money from your paying customers. nice try.
author: Robert L.

description: Great reataurant, and great food! Love the location, and the service is great! The fried chicken, kimchee stew, and kalbi are my friends favorites. Always here when im in the sunset :)
author: Sophia I.

description:
dissapointed.  had dinner here with a couple good friends yesterday but was the first to show.  we sat down, saying we had a reservation and was immediately seated.  i was thinking "ok, pretty empty and they actually require reservations?"  waitress sat us down and we ordered tea.  we had no idea there was a charge for that - no big deal, i guess.  as we're waiting for our friends to come, we decided to order an appetizer.  eventually my friends come and we order the food.  here's the food selection:

deep fried chicken wings (7 pieces) + $2 for garlic sauce
not bad, sauce wasn't so good.   didn't know there's an extra charge for the sauce

deep fried whole chicken - sweet & spicy
tasted like Chinese peking pork chops, but the chicken was hella dry

kimchi fried rice
like any other.  decent portion i guess

spicy rice rolls with fish cake
super spicy, lots of sauce, very little rice rolls and pretty much no fish cakes

seafood pancake
this was the highlight - i thought this was the best dish of the bunch we ordered.  flavorful and had a nice crunch.  friends thought it was a little soggy

-there were a lot of extra charges for the 5 of us, about $18/person with automatically included 18% gratuity - wtf isn't that for parties of 6 or more??
-bonchon plates were small - we asked for a little more and there was an extra charge without telling us
-waitress got kinda lazy.  she started placing everything on the end of the table instead of what most waitresses do - try to place everything in the center
-the music got suddenly loud at the end of our stay - maybe they wanted us to leave?

bottom line: nope i wouldn't come back.  the pancake was pretty awesome but the service wasn't excellent.  food was expensive for what it was.  the owner/chef seemed really friendly though.  too bad, i hate giving small businesses low reviews
author: M T.

description: We went there for dinner last night and it was excellent.  The sauces were amazing and the noodles were cooked perfectly.  The kimchi was great.  Perfect texture and seasoning.  Our waitress was delightful and very helpful.  Couldn't wait to eat the leftovers today.  We will be back!
author: Greta R.

description:
Hm...this isn't a totally traditional Korean restaurant, its a Japanese-Korean Fusion spot. Since this is "The Crew" spot, where's the sushi? Jk. This used to be the Pine Korean Restaurant and now its The Crew. Pine Restaurant was OKAY, wasn't too impressive because it was shady looking inside. 

The Crew is not as dimly lit, but its a bit cramped judging the space its given too. Reminded me of a hole in the wall joint near Korea University. Tight spaces, small corridors similar to the back alleys of Anam. Yeah...

This place is open til 2 AM. My kind of late night after drinking spot perhaps?

FOOD: 

Takoyaki - Not bad. Plenty of tako in there since I could visually see it within the lightly fried tempura ball of tempura fragments. 

Japchae - Eh..I could live without it here. Not impressed. A bit too heavy on the sesame oil. 

Hae Muul Paejeon (Seafood Pancake) - Large, thick, plenty of ingredients, HOWEVER, it lacked flavor. It was almost like a thick BLAND pancake with stuff in it. Not disappointed too much since I soaked it with sauce. 

Fried Tempura Style Calamari - Crispy, delicious, and lightly fried. Not too oily, wasn't soggy and tasted great with kimchi!

Korean Fried Chicken - You know..it sorted of reminded me of a bloated kfc chicken wing, but not skimping out on the spices. MEH...BLAND. We waited what..30 minutes for...this? 

Galbi - Very simple, a bit too chewy but no complaints really. Again..where's the marinade? I think there's a trend going already.

Soju Cocktails - Visually appealing and it got my friend buzzing quick. Light weight...lol

Tofu Soup - Typical tofu soup to me. Nothing special. 


SERVICE: (+2)

Staff are definitely attentive and tolerant. Or group was quite loud once the alcohol started flowing. You know Koreans.. xD This is a dinner only place so I hope no one on here starts bitchn. 

I'd come back every once in awhile.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Ordered Kimchi fried rice and it smelled like s#!* literally--diarrhea to be exact! Let the imagination fill u in for the smell... LOL
The food stank up my whole car and my room. At first, I didn't know where the smell came from... Once I found out, omg. I've never had any Korean food smelling this awful. Food was alright. Cashier looked and seemed very friendly. Gave him a dollar tip for the warm smile.
author: ABC Z.

description: I was waiting for another restaurant in the area for a table. After giving for the long wait, I decided to give The Crew a try since he said this place was good. I decided to order the Seafood Tofu Soup and the side of free Gyoza if you check in. Our order was taken quickly and came out fast. The tofu soup was not too spicy, but I would ask the make my order spicier. The tofu soup came with a decent amount of seafood, but I wish the clams were bigger with a little bit more squid. They did offer sides of Banchan as usual and would refill them without any hesitation. The server who took care of our table was very friendly and even offered to double the order of Gyoza since we had a big party which was nice of him to do. Their service here is very attentive as they frequently checked up on us and brought us more water and sides of Banchan. Overall another good addition to the number of Korean restaurants on my list in San Francisco.
author: Peter C.

description: Usually come here for quick lunch.  They have check in offer for gyoza which makes it worthwhile to come here.  Today,  they said they stopped offering the gyoza as a check in perk, and only offered ONE can of soda as constellation (there were two of us in our party). Yelp offer is still on the app so beware of the false advertisement.
author: Veronica L.

description: the place was hopping and we were seated fairly quickly.  service was attentive.  I thought food was just ok and it didn't make me feel like I wanted to come back anytime soon.  the chicken wings came out hot and were good.  the kim chee fried rice was a high portion and so were a few other dishes we ordered.  but like I said, I left and didn't think about the food again.
author: n y.

description:
It's only right to bring your crew members to this joint, grill up some korean short ribs and wash them down with some yogurt soju. They've got the korean fanfare down, and play up the drinking grill-fry dishes. They've got cute korean waitresses. It's just they're not nearly as good as Toyose that's also in the area. 

There's nothing to hate about this place, but then there's nothing spectacular for me love about it either besides it being open until the wee hours of 2am.

I wouldn't ever go out of my way to go here, unless everything else's shut down. Just like how I wouldn't order their overly sweet yogurt soju drinks unless I'm left without a choice.
author: Linh L.

description:
SERVICE:  They seriously need to hire another server or get more competent servers. Two servers on a Sunday night, with a decent number of people waiting outside on a chilly evening. We were the next group at a party of 3, and I kid you not, we stood outside freezing our asses off staring at an empty table for ten minutes. The guy was super incompetent, he must have walked by that table at least twice and only stopped over there to take the money. It's like he refused to bus the dirty dishes and set up the table for the next group (us). It seemed like both servers were sitting behind the counter several times, either tending the register or refilling banchan. We eventually got let to another table that was empty after some time. They did apologize for the wait, and service started out friendly, but sometime during the meal it just randomly switched. On at least 3 separate occasions, we asked the guy server for a refill on the banchan dishes. After the first time, you think he either forgot or didn't hear the request, but after the third time he's just straight up ignoring your request. Whatever, let's ask the girl. She acknowledges our requests with a nod, never brings it to us. Look I get it if you don't serve refills on banchan. Some Korean restaurants don't, but express it to your customers so we're not asking 3-4 times and thinking that you're straight up ignoring us, because quite frankly that will affect your overall tip.


FOOD:
+ Gyoza: Free order with check-in. The dipping sauce is so mild you can't even taste it. But hey, it was free, I'm not complaining.
+ Kimchi Fried Rice: decent portion
+ Garlic Chicken Wings: One of their "specialties". It was good, not fantastic, but good.
+ Spicy Tofu Soup (with beef): Probably my favorite of everything served, but super sad they don't serve an egg with it. Also surprised they don't give an order or rice with their soup too...
+ BBQ Pork Belly: not a huge fan of pork belly.

Service was a huge downer for me. Considering there are other places to get better Korean food for the same price, I'd rather go where the service doesn't flat out ignore your requests...
author: Jenna H.

description:
Service was spot on even thou there was only one girl (Kimberly?) working with about 4-5 tables to take care of.

Good sausage stew (hot pot), good portions and the seasoning was excellent.

Gyoza also on point. Crunchy yet soft, and not greasy.
author: Richard B.

description:
I was pretty excited to try out this place when I found out that a new Korean restaurant opened up in the Sunset. Seeing the menu reminded me of a less-packed Toyose type of restaurant, so I was excited to try the food. 

I came in with my friend around 2:00 in the afternoon (they close at 2:30), the waiter was super nice and let us take our time to order our food even though they were closing very soon. 

My friend ordered the soft tofu soup and I ordered the kimchi fried rice. Since it was lunch hours, the menu prices were very reasonable for the large portions that we received. In addition, we received the special deal of free gyoza when we checked in on Yelp. Overall, it was a very decent restaurant in terms of service.

Now for the food. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't anything too special to me. It did slightly remind me of Toyose, but I definitely prefer Toyose much more. The kimchi fried rice was not very flavorful, but it was very filling. The gyoza was slightly oily but it was  piping hot when served!
author: Vivian L.

description: Great food, great service and as a fellow Korean native, I'd like to say that the taste is great even with a modern touch.
author: Soy K.

description: I love the dolsot bibimbap! First time in this place and didn't expect that it's going to be so goooooood! Food is so good but i think they should put a little bit more meat but anything else is very good. Service is ok. Staff is nice and friendly they make sure you're ok and enjoying your food. Lunch special is excellent and not to pricey!
author: Patricia C.

description: Food is so good! Love the pork belly!
author: Vany P.

description:
My husband and I came here for dinner in a weekday and it wasn't very busy. K-Pop was playing, which I thought was very appropriate. We ordered the croquettes, Bim Bim Bop, and the Yam noodles. They were all tasty and vegetarian. Service was great!

The same week my husband came here with his uncle and they shared the Short Ribs, apparently they were so delicious his uncle wanted to get a 2nd order! They melted right off the bone and had a great flavor. He'll definitely be back for those.
author: Crys L.

description: Loveee this place, the food is delicious and in huge portions and we got complimentary ice cream in the end! A++ customer service too!!
author: Jenny L.

description: I really enjoy eating here with friends after a long day at work. we usually just come in grab a bottle of soju and beer and get some chicken wings which are one of the best yangnyeom  wings from my perspective in town. We also get san gyeop sal also which is really tasty.   I really like the atmosphere there!  the customers and the kitchen staff and wait staff are really nice and they pay attention to details.  I work as a chef for the past 18 years and i really like how all the pan chan and everything tastes like its made in house, the lettuce is always crisp and clean, plus i really like the music they play there also.  keep up the good work!!!
author: David P.

description: I absolutely love the beef with some raw garlic and jalapenos on the side. It is amazing. I chase it down with some soju and a bottle of ob. The waitress is so sweet. She doesn't hesitate to help us with anything. The kimchi soup is so fucking bomb. Try it! It's a must!
author: Alvin D.

description: I think it is pretty good and the server is very nice. The soft tofu soup is tasty. plus, got a plate of free gyoza for check-in to yelp.
author: Nad M.

description: This place to me was extremely bad, I went there and there were probably only three groups of people there. We were seated right away but nobody took our order for 25 minutes and the server for the night didn't offer us anything to drink while we waited all she did was stay in the back. The food looked great but the waiting game was worse we were ignored the minute we were seated.  Over all experience bad service.
author: Cody C.

description: I liked the food and soju drinks here. Tasty and pretty cool servers. Will def come back sometime!
author: Senait K.

description:
Came here for lunch on a week day.

Had the Kimchi ramen, so tasty.  The only waitress was very attentive and friendly, which made our dining experience that much better.

Definitely coming back!
author: daphne w.

description:
Food -  We ordered the "Volcano Chicken Bowl" because unfortunately they were out of the Korean dried-fried chicken wings. While we were disappointed that we did not get our wings, the chicken was still quite good and spicy. In addition, also tried the seafood pancake which was crispy and well-seasoned. Lastly, tried the bulgogi which was a tad bit drier than I prefer, but was still delicious and contained strong flavors. Soju was also quite tasty. 

Service - We went on a Tuesday night, and there was only one waitress who attended to our needs and was quite flexible to our requests. She checked in on us frequently and gave us exactly what we needed when she could. 

Overall not too shabby Korean-fusion place for the price. Would come back again, but going to have to call in to make sure there is sauce for their dried fried chicken wings!
author: Jennifer Hom C.

description:
Found this little gem with the bf one hungry day for lunch! Their kalbi is marinated to perfection! We get it everytime now granted this is only my third time here. Heheh we tried the ramen with dumplings- which was yummy but not really worth it since we had  pay more for the dumplings. The second time around we got the spicy pork - omg delish! Spicy and fatty hehe what can possibly be wrong with that combo. 

Waitress n waiters are super friendly. They dont give you death stares for asking refills on their side dishes. =) 

Recommend this place! Have been meaning  try their soju one night but never had the chance yet. 

:
author: Christina N.

description: I really love this place, it's very unpretentious and the food is great...cooked by the mom in the back, with help from dad.  Daughters and aunt wait tables and are very sweet (guessing it's daughters and aunts based on their dynamic) I've had the hot spicy tofu soup twice and it's really amazing, just what the doctor ordered if you are craving something hot, brothy, spicy and filling.   Last night I tried the sweet spicy chicken wings thinking I'd eat half of 8, and what do you know, yep, cleaned them out.  They were just perfectly sweet, crunchy, garlicky, yummy.  I noticed the chicken was particularly tender and seemed like they do their own butchering.  Last but not least the Korean videos in the background are great.  I really like the energy of this unpretentious place, I'll keep coming back!
author: claudia v.

description:
My experience at The Crew was great! First off I have never tried Korean food in my life, simple because my family is not Korean and does not know how to eat Korean food. my friend recommended me to try this restaurant, and I'm so glad I did! 

They start you off with drinks and little side dishes and I thought they were super cute! Like it was vegetables and potatoes and it was great for starters. The first things I've tried were the French fries, because I was craving them and they weren't that special to because they're just French fries. However, the kimchi fried rice was the star of the show! And ever since then I am HOOKED on this, and order take out very often! 

This is my first review, and usually I am very lazy to write reviews but since I love this restaurant so much it gets the honor of being my first! I definitely recommend that you try this place out, you will not regret this. :)
author: Marlene T.

description: This restaurant has been on our "must try" list for a while. The place is a little small, but the food is excellent. The best stone pot bibimbap and tofu stew my family and I have every had. We will definitely be back.
author: Nicholas T.

description:
Calamari was not really with it. Wasn't a lot. Salsa was ranch -_-

Seafood pancake tasted like pancake. Where's the seafood?

Service took FOREVER! Took about 50 minutes to get both orders. 

Overall, kind of disappointed. Service was ok. 

What? Minimum $20 credit card -__-

I don't think I'll come back....
author: Jasmin T.

description: Must try the grilled combo that comes with pork belly, short rib, and beef intestines. If you don't like intestines, get extra short rib (kalbi) because it is juicy and delicious! They give great customer service every time I come here! Definitely my go to spot when I crave Korean bbq!
author: Jenny V.

description:
Pricing: Good. Comparable to other Korean places.
Quality: Good. Not super amazing, but still hit the spot
Turnaround: Good. Kind of empty actually.
Service: Good. Nothing to complain about.

My friends and I are frequent patrons to Korean restaurants because the craving for a seafood pancake or tofu soup sometimes hit us like a the pang of nostalgic memory from our homesick hearts. No, we are not Koreans, just a group of Asian girls who grew up in a pretty Asian-strong US city with plenty of good food all around (go Bay Area!). The pricing was comparable to any other Korean restaurant serving this kind of bar-like food so no complaints there. We ordered the seafood pancake, beef tofu soup, bulgolgi, and kimchi fried rice. The seafood pancake had a good variety of shrimp and tako, but came out a little mushy instead of crispy with not enough green onions so fell short on fragrance. The tofu soup was good and I could have gone with just the soup without the beef since the beef was a bit chewy and bland. The serving size for the soup was small and they did not offer a larger size, which was weird since Koreans, like any other Asian group, like to share their food. Next up, the bulgolgi was cooked to a tender and juicy consistency, but the flavor lacked the strong sweet marinated taste that I am use to with bulgolgi. The kimchi fried rice was good in its own right, but they only have us one small egg to go with the rice and the egg just was not raw enough to run all over the rice. We came early before dinnertime to an empty restaurant besides one other family so our food came rather quickly, which is good for us. The service was also fine since they had two servers and with only two tables to wait, we were offered enough attention for any water refill and clearing the tables promptly.
author: Jenny W.

description: I came here with a coworker for lunch a little before noon. A medium sized restaurant with a decent sized amount of seating. We were the first ones and it didn't get busy with only 1 other table arriving throughout our meal. I ordered the bi bam bap and my coworker ordered the kalbi. The bi bam bap was alright, not too flavorful and it tasted relatively healthy. It tasted as if the ingredients were just thrown in together without much flavoring. The kalbi dish was very small but my coworker enjoyed it. There were side dishes (pickled bean sprouts, cucumbers, kimchee, fish cake and radish), which surprisingly was not spicy. Service was good. Next time I am going to check in for the free gyoza!
author: Rosanna T.

description: My husband and I were walking on Noriega looking for a quick bite to eat for lunch (before our afternoon plans in GG park) . We were cheerfully greeted and seated.  The waitress/owner, served our appetizer plates immediately and made us feel comfortable.  The food is superb and perfectly seasoned.  Our every need was anticipated and we felt like VIPs!
author: Debbie S.

description:
This place went way beyond my expectations! The crew has only been open for about a month but the food is as good if not even better than the korean restaurants I've been to in the city. The food tastes very home made and authentic  and they serve some unique dishes you can't find anywhere else. I love the grilled pork belly and the soju cocktails! They also have these really good spicy chicken feet, its a must try! 
The service is quick and friendly. The waitress came by our table many times to make sure everything was okay. The decor is a little simple and they have other little things to improve on here and there but overall it was a great experience and I will definitely be back for more delicious food and drinks!
author: Shannon P.

description: I was excited to try this restaurant but was severely disappointed. I went on a Saturday night and the place wasn't too full-- however there was one waitress working. They took a while to get our order (she was getting silverware for an empty table while I had my hand raised for a while to get her attention to order), the side dishes came like 25 minutes after we ordered, the rest of the meal even later. She was nice but the service just sucked at this restaurant perhaps due t being understaffed. The free gyoza wasn't given to us until we reminded them we had ordered it. We didn't get offered water or drinks and it wasn't offered to us. The cheese ttokbeoki was way too sweet and had like 10 pieces of ttokbeoki. Tofu soup was watery. However, the pork belly was pretty good-- it had a great grilled aroma. Overall, hated wasting money on a restaurant I was so excited to try.
author: Dee L.

description: Awesome service here!! I used the yelp check in for the goyza. Their chicken is delicious!!!  I would come again if I'm in the area!
author: Gray L.

description: Overpriced decent food. $28 for some tofu and pork stew. Not worth it. Can make it at home for the price of $5 or even less.  Not ever going back here again. Service was decent. Side dishes were small, not much selection or variety. It's very upsetting to see the $$$ bill with cheap ingredients
author: Jennifer Q.

description: Fantastic and open late, definitely try the Korean Fried Chicken, the Seafood pancake, and the Bulgogi Beef, the sausage hotpot was meh, the short rib one was good. Fun to see Korean music videos on the tvs. The soju cocktails are great, highly recommend the lychee one.
author: Michael Z.

description: Paid $9 for 25 cent top ramen. Seriously,? Thats freaking robbery. And they did nothing to try to transform it. So mad, if I wanted sub par top ramen, I couldve made it myself and saved $8.75 doing so. If you're craving korean food at night, better look elsewhere or wait till better places open the next day. Oh yeah, chicken was oversauced and dry at the same time.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Stopped by last night with the bf for a late dinner. After pondering the menu for awhile, we ended up ordering the gal-bi tang (beef rib soup as recommended by the server) and the seafood pancake. He soon after brought us some nice hot cups of tea, a small bowl of edamame, and an assortment of banchan (pickled radish, fresh kimchi, steamed egg, brocoli and fish cake). They make the banchan in the kitchen and you can definitely tell. I normally don't care for pickled radish but the one they make here has a nice sweetness to it even though its still a bit spicy. The food came soon after. The gal-bi tang was very flavorful for being such a simple dish. It paired well with the bowls of rice and the banchan. The seafood pancake was delicious even though there could have been more seafood. The server was very attentive and made sure we liked the soup and our banchan was always refilled. 

Not sure who was playing the music but we were jamming to slow jams the entire time we were eating. Reminiscing about middle school/high school and singing along while we ate. 

The tab came out to just under $30 before tip. Yes, it's a bit pricey here but for the service and quality of food, I think it's fair. Hope this place does well because I plan on coming back to try their drinks and more of the food some time. The soju cocktails sounded delicious!
author: Sarah L.

description: Came here for lunch takeout and ordered some chicken Wings.  Took about 15-20 mins for it to come out.  The cashier was pretty cool.  Also the gyoza was great! The chicken wings were dry fried and were all right.  They had a decent amount of flavor and texture was good.  I would come back just for the gyoza tho.
author: Brian C.

description: The food and service is outstanding, friendly staff that comes up to check on us to make sure we're completely satisfied. The only unpleasant features are the strange smell in the dining area and some average dishes that actually costs over $20.  The tables however were arranged nicely for the space and capacity. With that being said their BBQ dishes, soups, unlimited veggie plates were great. Notice that not all tables have the burners.
author: Will F.

description:
Went there by accident recently. 

A great new gig! Their service was excellent and food was authentic. Bimbibap was tasty especially with galbi tang (soup). Glad I found them randomly.
author: Wine L.

description: Love the wings and all the small dishes that come with each meal. Bibimbap was pretty good, ramen was just okay (kind of tasted like packaged noodles).
author: Kim H.

description: Last Friday me and 4 of my friend went to Korean BBQ restaurant in south san Francisco having a combination dinners for 4-5 people, the foods is not enough for 4 people and tast not too good, so on my way home past by crew I decided to order my dinner again since I still hungry.  I order Bulogi( thin sliced beef), very tasty and good portion.   That means sometimes the restaurant not too big still carry good foods, and will go back try out the diff. items
author: MAE C.

description: Large portion definitley a place tp go to with a huge group of friends and eating family style.
author: Daniel S.

description: I love this place. The best Korean restaurant I ever have the chance to try. There are so much flavor for this place I would totally come back.
author: Michael Q.

description: What a little gem in the Sunset. Girlfriends first Korean experience here was awesome!
author: Arthur G.

description: Place is good, but I think all Korean food is good. This place is a bit pricy for the portion sizes, $22 for short ribs at dinner. You dont get to cook your own food unless you order specific items on the menu. This place is open until 2 am which is good for those midnight munchies but watch the wallet!
author: Rob T.

description: Service definitely as reviewed - and everyone is super cute (how'd you manage to hire that..)! Loved that the cook came to 'perfect' our bbq (helping the non-Koreans, I guess;). Was there for the first round (5:30 on a Friday) which packed the small place. Japchae a dream. Kimchi at perfect spiciness. Tonkatsu chicken huge. Will come for the soups next time. Only regret was the lack of vegetables consumed - would love if they had more available.
author: Eos d.

description: Another successful Yelp find for me and my family who is visiting town. My brother and sister was looking for a place that has Takoyaki.  The other place in Irving was too small for us so I Yelped another place and I found this. Just relying on how many stars, it was absolutely and amazing experience. My whole family loved every food that we ordered (did I mention that their Takoyaki was the bomb too? AND the pork belly, etc?). Another hole in the wall that was amazing. Try it.
author: Eva L.

description: Nice korean/Japanese korean restaurant. When we checked in we got free gyoza. They also started the meal with edamame. My friend ordered the kimchi fried rice and I order the seafood tofu soup. Both were delicious. The bon chon was good too. I will definitely come back again.
author: Jason L.

description:
Came in with my homies at 1am for some drunchies. 

Pretty pricy for typical and very limited Korean dishes. We ordered three bbq dishes family style and they came one after another. All the dishes were loaded with onions on the bottom and the onions tasted different in each dish. Chicken and spicy pork were mediocre. Sliced spare rib was horrible. $60 including tip for three onion dishes. Not coming back again.
author: Mike Z.

description: fried chicken wings were terrible and expensive.  The food health score confirmed what I already knew.
author: josh d.

description: These guys really are a ripoff. Just noticed that 20% tip thing. Been coming here occasionally for years never noticed that 20% tip. I've always thrown extra tip on top.
author: Tony M.

description: We were looking for noodles and found noodles!  Not sure how busy they are on weekends but later in the evening on a weekday we were able to be seated immediately.  Appetizers were all really good and I was quite happy with my spicy kimchi ramen.  Would definitely try it again
author: Jessica G.

description: I don't think I've ever had Korean before so while on our way to the airport we stopped in. We loved the food! Rachel had the pork and I had the Jabche. Both were delicious and the prices were great.
author: David S.

description:
First time here. Can't find a decent Korean fried chicken restaurant in the Bay Area. I prefer plain fried chicken without the bones Korean style. Unfortunately their fried chicken comes with bones. Asked for sauce on the side of the plain fried chicken but they don't offer that. Had to pay for full price with BBQ sauce.

If fried chicken in Seoul is 10/10 this place would rate appx a 7. Chicken was a little soft and not as crispy as it should be but it's the best I found so far for Korean fried chicken.

Sat down for over 10 mins after ordering but no banchan was provided. Asked why and was told a whole fried chicken isn't a main course... But the item is listed in the main menu section!!
author: T C.

description: Kimchi fried rice. Stop whatever you are doing and get this. Oh, and the fried chicken.
author: Nick L.

description:
I would give The Crew 3.5 stars so I rounded up since they are open until 2am! And late night Korean is definitely worth the round up. 

I was expecting a lot considering the amazing yelp reviews and was a little disappointed because of that.  I got the dolsit bimbimbop. Nothing to write home about & the service is what you would expect at a place like this (kinda reminds me of a diner) but it is good & definitely met my craving. I will go back again for my late night Korean fix.
author: N A.

description: what can I say, from the host to the server and the food. great neighborhood spot, I take friends, family and visitors. never disappointed. no regrets.
author: Justin P.

description: No wait.  Ordered the sweet and sour fried chicken wings, japchoy, spicy veggie tofu soup.  Fried chicken was comparable to San tungs, but there was too much sauce for my liking.  Japchoy was probably the best with a sweet soy based sauce that I've never tasted before and japchoy is probably my favorite korean dish.  Spicy tofu soup also good but nothing spectacular.  Definitely spicy!  Bbq and budae jigae a little too pricey, otherwise would've ordered.  With one large Ob beer for two, total came to 50 bucks.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Nice place on Noreiga and 20th which produces really good food.  Tonight I had the dolcet bibimbab was nice and crispy, just as I like it.  The chapchae was also perfectly done.
