I know I found the place because it was right next to the tikibar but it was friendly, clean, and tasty.  Check it out.
author: Charles R.

description: Being Korean, I can be picky. SF does not compare to L.A., Chicago, or NYC. That being said, "The Crew" is my go to place for Korean comfort food. I often daydream about the Kamja Tang and Budeh Jigae. Plus the staff are very nice.
author: Ike K.

description: I had their dolsot bibimbap and it was good. The waitress was friendly and attentive.
author: Phillip K.

description: good food, open late, fair prices, interesting music, fun crowd.
author: Adam G.

description: This place is BOMB. I got the crazy spicy ramen and it was absolutely delicious, I'll be coming back here again for sure. Not to mention the delicious kimchi that came with it. I'm planning on eventually trying everything they have on their menu. Check this place out for sure!!
author: Misha A.

description:
The Crew is new kid in the block. (Korean, Japanese fusion )
They are still new but service is great and food is fantastic.
author: David K.

description: The kimchi fried rice was good. The tofu soup was okay. We also ordered the spicy chicken, which was pretty good.
author: Jacqueline K.

description: Food was ok  our kim chee fried rice was ok. The seafoid pancake had non existent seagood with too many strips of green onions. Otherwise, huge portions and a decent plsce to visit if you want somewhere easy and convenient.
author: John H.

description:
Came here to try the cocktail soju the other night. We had the mango soju, which at first tasted good (because of its sweetness) and then the after taste hit us. It had some sort of a sweetener after taste so it was clear that the mango soju was not made fresh but with some mango cordial. It was alright but I would probably try the yoghurt soju if I were to go again to avoid the "fake" taste. 

The chicken karaage was pretty good. I like the dipping sauce that comes with it.
author: Felicia P.

description: Great Korean restaurant. Similar to Manna on Irving. I recommend the spicy tofu soup, it's not ver spicy so it is bearable. The service is very spotty. The older lady ignored our table multiple times, but if you get the younger girl, she is very kind, attentive, and friendly.
author: T L.

description:
I've been to The Crew twice now, both super late night when the food cravings hit (and honestly, there aren't that many places to get food that late in the Sunset). Both solid experiences! Service was pretty good. 

What I've tried:
-Seafood pancake: OMG. This is so good. Perfect mix of chewiness + crispiness + super packed full of seafood goodness! I was really happy to get a good amount of shrimps, calamari, etc. 
-Garlic wings: I loved these, I think they're my favorite item so far. They're the sweet Korean glazed & fried chicken wings. The portion is really big, though, so I would share or get this when I'm very hungry.
-Spicy ramen: VERY spicy! I only tried a little bit of this dish, I couldn't handle too much of it! 
-Pork belly: Good, nicely grilled up, and the pan was sizzling when it came out. Sauce was just right to pair with the meat. But the portion seemed a bit small compared to the price. 
-Potstickers: YUM! I got these free with Yelp check-in, LOVE it!!! They are nicely crispy and the sauce it's served with goes with it perfectly. 
-Sides: They give a good amount of them! I don't really remember them but I didn't have any complaints. 
-Rice bowl: A LOT of food, good portion for the price. I only tried a few spoonfuls of it but it was good. 

Overall, a nice place! It's open pretty late and has solid food.
author: Mary N.

description: As least on my first visit there, I can tell I will like this place over the previous ownership (Pine Restaurant) in that they have a tasty soy bean paste stew that I really like.  It's great in its level of spiciness, just like another place on Geary in the Outer Richmond that I had been somewhat regularly venturing to for satisfying the craving (although over there on Geary the young lady manager was cuter and more attractive :) ).  The one thing I think could improve is the lighting for the tables which have the large fume hoods above it.  Somehow the resulting darkness doesn't seem to have a good feel (at least in my opinion).
author: H K.

description: I went there last week and got a burger, was good af. Everything else was pretty expensive. The waitress was very nice and served up water while I waited even though it was a to go order. Would recommend
author: Chris F.

description: Love this place!! Always love coming here for the free gyoza with the check in. At times service is slow but over all both food and service is pretty good.
author: C N.

description:
Back again! This time we order the sweet and spicy whole chicken, kalbi, bibimbob and the spicy pork rib stew with potatoes and the free gyoza from checking in on Yelp. 
The sweet and spicy whole chicken is just freaking yummy, and I would  order it again the next time I eat here -drools-! The kalbi was just as good but not better than the chicken. The gyoza is simple and well taste like every other gyoza I had eaten before haha but still good :d.  The hot pot.. was not as good as I thought, the soup is nice but I constantly taste the bean sprout from every sip of the soup. Maybe is because I don;t like the taste of bean sprout but it was decent~

Seriously, this waiter has the best customer service..ever! He's friendly and would come by to ask us if we needed anything or if the food was up to our taste, refilling our water and tea.

P.S Get the sweet and spicy whole chicken!
author: Jessica T.

description: Well the food is OK, the drinks not bad, the price is reasonable, will I go back again? Will I'm live in Oakland.  Well if happen I'm in SF and happen that my friends want to get Korean yes I will go back.
author: Henry H.

description: I can never get sick of the Crew.  If you want really good Korean food, come to this place.  My favorite go-to Korean restaurant in the Sunset of San Francisco.  I usually order Spicy Ramen (with a side of lemon and Sriracha) or Sofy Tofu Soup and Kimchi Fried Rice.  Their fries are pretty awesome too (I know, I know, they're just fries but it's delish), ask for their karage sauce to go with it, you won't regret it :).  BBQ chicken is pretty good, ask for the sesame pepper dip, very good.  They usually know my order when I come it especially Jun, the lunch server.  He's great.  It's usually slow around lunch but dinner can be quite busy so be patient, the food is still great.  I'd go around 5:30-6 to avoid the busyness.  Their Kalbi and Japchae is pretty good too and of course their soju.  Not too sweet, not too strong, just perfect, try their mango.  Enjoy.
author: Dee L.

description: Stumbled in here and was very happy I did! HUGE portions, low enough prices, free Korean side dishes. Open until 2am every day (except Sundays = closed). Will definitely be back.
author: Kyle L.

description: I was pretty bummed when my fav Korean restaurant, Pine, changed ownership, but I wasn't pleasantly surprised with the replacement.  The customer service here is great, very attentive and nice.  The food is pretty good, I'm waiting for it to get even better as time passes.  So far I've had the bulgogi, pork gyoza, jup chae, tofu steak salad and kimchee fried rice.  All were tasty but my favorite is the kimchee fried rice, mildly spicy with a great taste.  Their fruit soju was great as well, a little on the pricey side though.  Nice place to go when you're having a late dinner, open till 2am.  Their menu is still the soft opening one, so l'm looking forward to their permanent one.  If you were a fan of the old Pine Restaurant, you'll enjoy The Crew.
author: Peggy C.

description: The food really reminded me of The hole in the wall places in Korea. I would definitely go back.
author: Mary L.

description: Actually been back a few times since writing previous review because they are the only restaurant around that's open really late. Explored their other menu options and had a better experience. I still avoid the galbi but the fried chicken is really good and it's a huge portion. Their bibimbap is also good. For late night I'd go back and give it 5 stars cause it's quite literally as good as it gets around here at that time but for lunch and dinner it's a decent choice.
author: Jay M.

description:
This is a new clean and bright Korean family owned restaurant.  The food is very good.  We ordered too many items, but everything was delicious:  kimchee pancake, kimchee fried rice, fried chicken wings, BBQ chicken, BBQ beef ribs, whole spicy chicken and tofu soup for my granddaughter that does not like anything spicy.  The banchan dishes were also very good and the waitress refilled them when the plates were empty.

The waitress is very sweet and polite and was attentive to our table.  The mother came by our table and offered each of our grandkids a Korean soda (on the house).  For dessert they served us strawberry mochi ice cream.  Grandkids loved it... we did too!

We will definitely be going back and bringing friends to this establishment.
author: Em D.

description:
It is hard to find a restaurant will open until 2 am on weekdays in SF. The good is ok and the services is good.  Waiters come and checked in with us so often. Make sure everything is ok.  But I was little disappointed about the combination grill, I expect more meat but it has huge union, 4 mushrooms, some beef and pork, 
Not too much selection form the menu.  
It is new so they have room to improve the menu and add more items on the menu.
I will go back and try again later
author: Bill C.

description: This is the new Japanese/Korean fusion restaurant. I went there with 5 of friends before we get wasted at the bar next to it. We ordered tonkatsu, fried chicken and korean pancake.(of course all fried food!! We love them!) The tonkatsu had cheese in between the meat.it was the best thing I ever had in my life. Mmmmmmm. Fried chicken came with some pickled radish. Pancake was crispy and had lots of ingredients I love. The service was polite and we will definitely come back for some Korean food.
author: Jamie K.

description: I like this place!  The food tastes like they take care in what they do.  Fresh ingredients and fresh oils.  The price for the quality is great.  Clean dining area, friendly servers, awesome Asian pop music to set the mood.  I feel comfortable inside which is always a plus :)
author: rOK B.

description: Absolutely amazing food and service! Had a great late night small of wings and free gyoza (with the yelp check-in). Definitely stop by if you can :)
author: Erica L.

description: Came in on a week night and no wait. The chicken was pretty good and we got the sauce with it. We checked in and got a free plate with was also tastey. Only issue is the kimchee fried rice was probably 20% butter. Probably closer to a 3.5 star but the service was great so I'll bump it up to 4 stars
author: Eddie L.

description: I ordered a Kimchi Fried Rice here when I was on my break.. Fast service and nice servers. Love their food!
author: Vicky Z.

description: Damn.. I can't believe I just found this place. I usually just drive all the way to San Jose to eat korean food because I think korean food in sf kinda sucks. But surprisingly all the dishes we ordered at the crew was delicious! KFC( korean fried chicken), spicy pork, cheese pork katsu? Was really good. I've been spoiled with great korean food in my life and this restaurant didn't disappoint.
author: soo l.

description: Amazing food and super friendly service. Ive been there several times and I would defiantly recommend the volcano chicken and the crew burger.  The volcano chicken is the big thing of chicken that could serve 2 to 3 people.  Its delicious and nice and spicy.  The crew burger is this great burger with nice korean flavor to it! As for sides I love their cheese katsu which are like mozzarella sticks, but with that amazing katsu breading that everyone loves. Love this place!
author: Justin L.

description: super friendly service. i ordered the spicy calamari to go, and it was so tasty. can't wait to go back for dinner
author: Pei P.
